title: Champion Update: Irelia the Blade Dancer

embed.description: A fierce defender trained in the ancient dances of Ionia, Irelia has adapted her art for war.

body:
All of her splash arts are so freaking good omg I can't even decide the best. I actually want to buy all of them and I am not even an Irelia player.

Maybe I am now.

Man when the heck do we get the update to North America? It's really annoying that we get all these updates and advertisements and nothing happens. We had a total of 2 updates for what. . .?
There is one thing of importance for me in this update. She's still a lich, right?

Irelia being a lich, with her soul contained in her blades rather than her body is an amazing and unique concept... and Riot doesn't like having those. Judging by the short available this far, she's a generic freedom fighter now.

Karthus is a LIch. Thresh's lantern contains Lucians wife's soul and absorbs souls. Varus is two souls entombed. 

Riot is garbage at remakes/reworks

Tell me more about how Ryze is in a better spot. For a second. 

Stop remaking. Just admit LCS is garbage and hinges on temporarily op/broken champions. 

You keep messing with champs/items/masteries/"keystones" and you keep perpetuating the problem. 

Irelia didn't need a remake. And certainly t should have never been hired. Mini games are garbage.

True, but Karthus is a classic lich. Someone who willingly undergone the transformation for all the, um, "benefits" of undeath and boasts the dessicated corpse/skeleton appearance commonly associated with that. Irelia not only inverts that trope, but her philactery being  her blades blurs the line of what's her body and what's the weapon and serves as an amazing way to explain why she can mind control her blades - certainly better than "durr she mastered the ancient and mystic art of <insert any magical form of combat here>" seen thousands of times ago.

And I fail to see how Ryze, LCS or balance has anything to do with champion stories. Different teams work on those two - Irelia's story being good, crap, worked on or abandoned doesn't mean anythingfor those.
I don't really see how irelia is a lich.
Wait what?
Old lore: she died at some point and got brought back to life with the ability to move her blades with her mind
We won’t know until the lore is released.

That's literally the only thing I could think about watching her trailer.
'So when is she gonna get murdered and Liched by Soraka???'

Oh well. The game gets more polished every year, but some of the story reworks have been kind of a waste of time

Boring and uninspired.
